dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen or so shadowy people are seated in the darkened r A slide projector dimly lights MR. FULLER, a crew-cutted Robert Stack type in a suit, as he addresses the group. T current slide is a still from a security video of a blurr figure - it could be any of about a billion people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...So, let's keep a steely eye out for this bastard. (THEN) Before we dismiss, this is your monthly reminder of why we're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuller advances to a slide of the American flag. Close on one of the group - a heavyset bald man in his mid-thirtie He politely pays close attention to the presentation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The American people want to travel. (Slide: Family in front of a fake dinosaur) They want to attend baseball contests (Slide: Fat guys spilling beers as they go for a foul ball) and popular music concerts. (Slide: John Tesh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on another face in the group. A doughy man with thr day scruff and a trendily long haircut. He looks bored, rolling his eyes at the speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want to be happy. (Slide: People line dancing) But, Security comes first. (Slide: Army soldier with a massive machine gun guards a play- ground) Without security there can be no happy. You are America's front line in the global war on terror. Let's hit the trenches and let's be careful out there. (Slide: TSA logo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights come up and as the group files out we get a be look at their uniforms. The TSA agents move out into the.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agents take their places, manning the screening equipment. We push in on the bald man as he takes up his post next to the walk-through metal detector. This is KIR KETTNER. He is not a looker. His uniform only serves to highlight his least attractive features but his eyes and demeanor are pleasant and kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scruffy agent is STAINER. He stands at the x-ray monitor. As the bags begin to move through, he does not p any attention, rather he hands Kirk a flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, bro.     Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT: The flyer reads, "Wheel in the Sky - a Tribute to Journey at Club Vertigo - Every Tuesday Night!" Stainer i pictured wearing a massive afro in the band photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Stainer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you never come see us anymore. It's been like four months. Time to forget about Marnie and get back on the whores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer does a sex dance that makes everyone uncomfortabl Fuller shoots a stern look from his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that. It's my Grandma. I'll probably be at the hospital for the next few nights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. I spaced that.   How's she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's hanging in there but it doesn't look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I'm sorry. She's a great lady. That sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Middle-Eastern man in a cowboy hat is next in line. Mr. Fuller appears behind Kirk, taps his shoulder and subtly motions to the Arab. Kirk smiles at the potential terrori

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, Habib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perfect English with a southern accent) Howdy Kirk. Lemme guess; I been flagged for a random search.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sorry. I'll get you out of here quick. You off to Boston again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. Pediatric convention in Delaware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk opens Habib's bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, I know you're just doing your job but, for Pete's sake, ya'll know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     It's just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk gestures to his boss as he zips the bag back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Habib, you're all set buddy. Have a good trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Kirk. See you next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuller again appears behind Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to fuller - now in a thick Arab accent) Praise be to Allah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's funny!? You wanna sit in first class or you wanna sit on my gloved and jellied finger!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow a pair of perfect female legs as the woman's heels click along the sidewalk, suitcase rolling behind. Althou we can't see the woman riding on these legs, we can see several men stare as she passes by on her way into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More stares from more men and even a few women as we foll the legs to the check-in line. The legs glide to the fron and stop to wait for the next available ticket agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the slightly upward angle, we see two young male tic agents. (One on each side of the legs.) One is black and white; each are dealing with customers. They simultaneous notice our woman. They suspiciously eye one another and t race is on. Each agent begins typing furiously to expedit their current customer in the hope of waiting on her next

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angle on the WHITE AGENT as he waits on a yuppie couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (RUSHED) Okay, how many bags are you checking? Any bags!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this one too big to carry on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    Carry it on. Good call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, you don't want to lug that thing all over the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agent leans back and issues a bothered sigh. He looks his right to check the progress of the BLACK AGENT, who i waiting on an old Asian woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (RUSHED) Did you pack your bags yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Asian woman obviously did not understand a word of th question but she smiles and nods along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone unknown to you asked you to carry anything onto your flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More smiles and blank nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you mean NO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't know what the hell I'm talking about!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where exactly is gate F5?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just past F4. Have a day now folks. Let's hustle it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sweat.     Keep it moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Asian woman is not going anywhere. The black agent le into her face and barks once like a dog. Her smile turns fear as she backs away, ending the race in a dead tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverse to show the woman they were competing for. She is classy, sophisticated, blonde around thirty. Drop dead beautiful. She is startled by the sudden call from both m She laughs off her little scare and then randomly chooses black agent. He shoots a smug victory grin over to his co worker, who is being an overtly sore loser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm booked on flight 94 to Burbank. Molly McCall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying way too hard) California. Fantastic. So do you travel quite a bit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white agent moves to loiter around the black agent's station, just to get a better look at MOLLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Derek. You got the     numbers on the (making it up as he    goes) new, um, procedures for the,    um, airport thing... regarding the,    ah, planes? (to Molly) Whassup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk is at his post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer works the next x-ray belt, where a young rocker t is running a guitar case through. Stainer stops the belt moves it back to get a better look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Les Paul Classic re-issue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SMUG) No, it's a sixty-five.   Mint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.    No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rocker boy looks at his watch as Stainer rolls the ca through and pops it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I'm late for my flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I have to search this case for, you know, explosives and such. This thing is sweet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer takes the guitar out and starts riffing on it as bins and bags pile up before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At Kirk's station, Molly (the blonde bombshell) is crossi through. Every guy who can see her has been struck dumb b Kirk banters with her like he would anyone else. No flirt or stammering - just friendly and relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second trip in two days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is putting her laptop back in her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uggh. Yeah. It's just a short hop to L.A. but they've got me going back and forth three days in a row. This client is killing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well hang in there kiddo and I guess I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly's long legs carry her toward the gates as every man except Kirk watches. Fuller saunters up and nudges Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did'ja see that? Boy would I ever like to...you know...put my penis in her vagina. (wink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at Stainer's station. As he puts the guitar back in case, he scratches it on the corner of the x-ray machine. Stainer and rocker boy lock in shocked gazes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs his guitar and inspects a wicked scratch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I am so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry my ass! This thing is worth more than you make in a year, you clumsy motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I bet it was but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer points to a white sign mounted in an acrylic stan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "TSA is not responsible for items lost or damaged in the security screening process..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer flips the sign around to reveal a few more words written on the back. He reads them aloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...so fuck you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk enters to find his MOTHER, an attractive old woman, sitting with a short, plain woman about Kirk's age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mom.   Hey Marnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi Sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the room, Kirk's father is speaking to a man who l a bit like Kirk. The man is telling a funny story that cracks up MR. KETTNER. The two pretend to box for a momen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that guy Dad's with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARNIE (the plain woman) stands and takes Kirk aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, you've been really great about your mom and I staying so close since we broke up but I know how much Grammy meant to you... Well, is it okay with you that I'm here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.   It's fine.   (it's not)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, good. Then can I introduce you to my new boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads Kirk over to the man who is speaking with his father. They are laughing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, this is Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, oh - the ex. Awkward! (Ron and Mr. Kettner laugh) No! I'm just jack-assin' with you, pirate. Great to meet you. How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Of course. I'm sorry about your grandmother. It's just so... Well, old people, you know, what are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's brother ERIC and his fiance DEBBIE enter from the hall. They are both in their late thirties and good-looki for trailer trash. Debbie is about seven months pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little brother.   Grammy wants to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Well, I better get in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Debbie walk with Kirk down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm pretty sure she wants to discuss the will. She won't tell us dick, so we're kind of hoping you can grease the wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but you know Grammy didn't have all that much. Once the hospital and... and the ah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, the cremation and what not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not going to leave enough to get worked up over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a wedding to pay for, Kirk and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie, let me handle this. We've got a wedding to pay for, numbnuts, and you know Mom and Dad are going to Branson next month. Now you always been Grammy's favorite so we're counting on you to get in there and sort out what's what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a dimly lit hospital room, a very old woman lies in a She is hooked up to an I.V. and several monitors. Kirk co in and forces a smile. Grammy's voice is weak and shaky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are Big Slick.   Did you bring 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grammy, you really shouldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hand 'em over. I'm on death's door and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk sits and reluctantly hands her a pack of cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for Christ's sake. Filters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grammy lights up a smoke and savors a long drag. Kirk tea up at how slightly his grandmother clings to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you Grammy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start that shit now. You're looking at one lucky old broad who's done a lot - skydiving, rollerderby, colored fellas. I got no complaints. So when the check comes I don't want any blubbering or bullshit outta you. Just enjoy your life like I did mine and raise a glass to your old Grammy once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk hugs her and he cries a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how much I love you Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is coming through Kirk's lane again. Mr. Fuller ste in and stops her before she crosses through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, could you please remove your jacket and shoes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does. Fuller is leering at her stellar body.   She's about to go through when he stops her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we go ahead and strip off that belt too while we're at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly takes an exasperated breath as she removes her belt She starts to move through but again Fuller stops her wit raised palm. He then motions to her breasts and crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any piercings you'd like me to know about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just come on through, ma'am, and we'll see if anything sets off the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly steps through. The machine does not go off. She gathers her things and mouths a silent, "Thank You" to Ki as she walks on. Fuller glares at Kirk but before he can anything, RANDY, a young agent, calls out from the office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk buddy! Phone call!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk walks over to take the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You best hope the terrorists are taking personal calls on the job too, mister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk takes the phone from Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Kirk Kettner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's expression tells us that some sad news is coming i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk sits at a table with a cup of coffee. He opens his wallet and flips to a photo of a much younger Grammy and eight-year-old Kirk in a casino. Grammy is smoking a cigarette and dealing blackjack while Kirk sits at the ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk tears up and puts his face in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is passing.   She sees Kirk and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Geeze. Please tell me I didn't get you in trouble back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. It's not that.    I ah...I lost somebody today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly sits down and puts her hand on his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. I'm so sorry. I know... I lost my grandmother a few months ago and I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk tears up again and so does Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your grandmother too? And you were close? Oh, you poor thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk tries to keep it together.   Molly looks at the phot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She used to be a blackjack dealer at the Horseshoe. When I was little, she taught me and my friends how to play poker. Turned us into a bunch of eight-year-old degenerate gamblers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a sad laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, your grandmother too, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly removes a small clear-plastic booklet of photos fro her bag and shows a picture of her grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Grammy Keenan was ninety four but independent right to the end. She was always trying to cook for everyone. You couldn't stop her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, I know. Grammy used to change her own oil. Right up until a few months ago. She was... Do you change your own oil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHS) No. I wouldn't know where to begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, me neither. She could barley walk and I'd come over and find her lying under her Cadillac all covered in grease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a laugh and Kirk is cheering up a bit.   An announcement comes over the PA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...final boarding call for United flight 94 to Burbank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, geeze, that's me. I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.   Go catch your flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly stands and offers her hand to Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk Kettner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly squeezes Kirk's hand, grabs her bags and trots off toward her gate. A businessman near Kirk's table reaches over and gives him a playful chuck on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead Grandma. (a nod and a cheek click) Nice one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly arrives at the gate just in time to make her flight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk gathers his things and notices that Molly left her pictures on the table. He looks through them. In the last pouch are some business cards that read, "Molly McCall - Event Planner." Her cell number is on the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is sitting in a window seat. The flight is mostly empty. The two other seats in her row are unoccupied unti CREEPY BUSINESSMAN moves from the row behind her to the s next to Molly. He casually smiles as though there is noth odd about taking the center seat while the aisle seat (an many full rows) are open. Molly looks at the vacant seats and then at him as if to say, "You've got to be kidding."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly's phone rings and she fumbles to answer it.   A FEM PASSENGER sitting two rows back looks annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi.   Molly McCall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's calling please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Kirk... From the coffee shop. You left your pictures with me. If you tell me which gate you're at, I can run them right down to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. I'm already on the plane and we're pushing back right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well I'll leave them at the lost and found and when you get...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh geeze, some of those are my only prints. It would be such a huge favor if you could hold on to them for me. I'm coming back next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure.    But how will I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The female passenger hails the flight attendant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's talking on her phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creepy businessman gives the woman the finger and the looks to Molly for approval. He doesn't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have your number in my phone. As soon as I get back I'll call you and arrange to pick them up, okay? Thank you so much, Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly turns off her phone and holds it up for the flight attendant to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.   I'm really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe these pricks? So, what do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk comes in and stops at the bar to order a beer. Two m are waving to him from a table near the stage. Kirk gets bottle and snakes through the crowd toward his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On stage, Stainer (in his afro wig) plays guitar as his b finishes the last chorus of "Lovin', Touchin' Squeezin'."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! We're going to take a little breakski but we'll be back in a few minutes to do Frontiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band turns to put down their instruments and the hous music kicks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk arrives where his friends are standing at a high bar table. DEVON looks like Howdy Doody at 33. JACK is good- looking and dressed semi-hipster. Devon gives Kirk a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Kirk.    How you been holdin' up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a rough week but, you know, all of the services and family stuff keep you pretty busy... I really miss her, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack hugs Kirk as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sounded like a hell of a lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck yeah! Kirk's Grandma was the shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer arrives, hugs Kirk and gives him a kiss on the he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's with God now, buddy - and you just know she's bustin' his balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk laughs and Stainer raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Stella!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all raise their glasses and take a drink.     Th just what Grammy wanted and it's cheering Kirk up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's cell phone rings.      He has to talk loud over th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?... Oh, Hi. I'm sorry I can barely hear you. I'm at a club and.... Club Vertigo? Oh, yeah - it's right down the street from there... Okay, sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, just a passenger. She accidentally left something with me. She's going to stop in and pick it up I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's coming here?      She a cute gal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well alright dude! That's a leave- behind. She digs you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No she doesn't.      Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does a leave behind and then just happens to be in the neighborhood? She practically has her hands in your pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, seriously - it's nothing.      She's way out of my league.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you said Marnie was out of your league and let's face it, Marnie's kinda nasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie is standing behind Stainer.     He doesn't miss a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Marnie...don't you think Marnie Tomkins is kind of nasty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you don't know Marnie Tomkins? She's just this girl. I thought you knew her. Anyway, she's pretty nasty looking... but you're looking good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, I'm sorry about Grammy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys slink away to give Kirk and Marnie some privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize she was never that crazy about me but I know how much you loved her and I hope you're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.   Thanks, I'll be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, are you going to Branson with your folks next month?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   It's not really my thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with Branson?     You too good for Branson now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Branson's...awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, your mom invited Ron and I along. We'd love to go but not if it's going to be weird for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk considers this.   It will be weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I mean the tickets are non- refundable but it's up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer overhears this and groans out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You should go. I'm sure you'll have a great time. Totally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie hugs Kirk.   This makes him uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, I'm sorry about what happened with us. You're going to make someone very happy someday, but you have to get over me first, okay? Is it a deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie hugs him again and then departs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to Branson with your fucking parents? And bringing her new fucking boyfriend!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He seems like a good guy, though.  He's an entrepreneur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the room they see Marnie return to Ron with a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entrepreneur? Kirk, I know that guy. He owns a Pizza Hut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?   That's a business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not even a real Pizza Hut. It's one of those strip-mall take- out ones. They don't even have chicken wings. The guy's a fuckin' douche bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got more going on than I do. That's all I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you can do a hell of a lot better than her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One door closes, another door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you Devon, that doesn't even make any sense. But take this broad that's coming here tonight - I got a feeling about her. You're gonna get on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Visualize it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate what you guys are trying to do but, I'm telling you, I have zero chance with this one and I'm completely okay with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's defeatist thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it isn't. It's just like saying I'll never go to the moon and I'm okay with that too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying you don't want to go to the moon? That's bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm saying that I never will go to the moon but I'm not going to get down about it because, you know - I never expected to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know. Technology and shit. You might go to the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk waves to someone at the door.   The guys look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys' POV: Molly is stepping toward them - dressed in beautiful gown. They laugh the way you might laugh at a particularly brutal football tackle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Frijole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.   Yeah, you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, bro. You'll go to the moon before you'll hit that. No chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly arrives at their table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!     There you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly hugs Kirk.    From across the bar, Marnie takes not

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I'm so overdressed. I just came from a work thing. Are you doing okay with...everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know... Hey, these are my best friends - Jack, Devon and Stainer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys' I.Q.s drop like stones as they shake her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just a nickname.    Doesn't really mean nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Here's your pictures - all safe and sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk hands Molly the pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much for taking care of them for me! I need to get some copies made. If I lost these...uugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trouble at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, have you eaten yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to go grab a bite. Let me buy you dinner to pay you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to pay me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I want to. Come on! The place across the street has the best greasy burgers in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A burger does sound good. (then to the guys) I'm going to just ah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly waves goodbye and heads for the door. Kirk starts t follow but Stainer pulls him back for a quick huddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude. It's cool that she's buying you dinner but do not get your hopes up about this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Believe me, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk catches up with Molly.   Marnie watches them exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big guy has overheard this and leans over to Stainer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good advice there friend. Your boy ain't got a prayer with that chick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talking shit about my buddy!? 'Cause I'm giving out free fuckin' ambulance rides!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Guy assesses the crazy on Stainer's face and stands d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I didn't think so!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Molly sit across from one another in a booth. WAITER arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start you off with something to drink ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a Bass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for your... brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?     Oh, I'm not her brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry. I just figured...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, a Bass sounds good. Make that two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.    Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... You know what I do, what about you? Your card said event planner. How'd you get into that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it wasn't the original plan. I went to law school. Ended up at a big firm but I hated it. Then, they asked me to plan the Christmas party. It was a big hit and a few months later I was done with law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.    Pernicious career move, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know what that word means. What was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Molly's smile. She finds Kirk's unabashed admiss very refreshing and endearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     Like, destructive or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. No, I don't think that's so perni...gious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pernicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good - new word. No, not pernicious at all. Not if you enjoy the work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really do. We do a lot of charity events and I get to work with some of the most amazing human beings on some really fun projects. Next month I'm doing a cancer benefit with Billy Joel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   I love Billy Joel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only downside is I have to do a lot of public speaking and I've always struggled with stage fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man - That's my number one fear. I'm terrified of getting up in front of people. I'd rather get a Kentucky root canal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly laughs. An older GOOD-LOOKING MAN steps up to the table and stands facing her with his back to Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I was just sitting over at the bar and I was wondering; has anyone told you today that you are absolutely stunning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you seriously hitting on me right in front of my boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Kirk and both men start to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah right! (Catches Molly's unspoken instructions.) But, yeah. I'm her boyfriend, I guess, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   Wow. Well... sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honest mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man gives Kirk a wink and wanders back to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get a load of that hair- piece? What is it with men? I mean, look at you. You're bald and you're fine with it. A little dignity is all I'm saying. The toupees and plugs and the teen- dream sports cars... Oh geeze, I'm sorry. Do you drive a sports car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drive a 94 Taurus. It's got AM/FM but I wouldn't call it a sports car per se.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly laughs and we hard cut through the following snippe of conversation as they eat, chat and laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So here's this little old lady trying to go through security with six pounds of weed in her girdle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut.   The food is being served.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! I love that book!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut.   The waitress is picking up the empty plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, a duck walks into a bar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut.   Molly is laughing while she's paying the bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've got an early morning. I should go. Thanks for coming along. This was really fun. And thanks again for helping me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you for dinner. I feel bad that you won't let me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, stop it. Listen, I handle some of the charity events for the Coyotes and I've got some tickets for the hockey game tomorrow night. You interested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk is a bit taken aback and confused.     Is she actual asking him out on a real date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NERVOUSLY) Um, sure. Yeah, great. I mean, I'm free tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She digs two tickets out of her purse and hands them over

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. I hate to see them go to waste. There's two so maybe bring Stainer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's expression is as much relief as disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right.     Thanks!   Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Stainer are on their way through security. A hug security guard runs a metal-detector wand over Stainer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha runnin' there a PX-235?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two hundred series are dog shit. You couldn't find a bazooka with that thing. You should look into the new eight fifties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you keep it moving sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Stainer arrive at the third row to find two open seats right next to the penalty box. To Kirk's surprise, the next seat - Molly! Kirk elbows Stainer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's Molly.       She's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guys! You made it! Hooray! Thanks for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.     Wouldn't miss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the sweet seats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, this is my best friend in the whole world, Patty. This is Kirk and, um, Stainer, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty is over 200 pounds with a pretty face and an edge t comes from a lifetime of taking crap from morons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey boys.     Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty's my assistant and my go-to gal. Whatever you need, she can make it happen on a moments notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a cock-shaped cake with a cotton-candy bush delivered by four o'clock? I'm your connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and she likes to shock people so don't let her freak you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout that. So, we're going to grab some beers. Can we bring you ladies anything? Beer? Nachos? Patty, cotton candy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer and Kirk stand in the beer line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. She's setting you up with the fat chick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooohhh! Okay! Okay! That makes sense, right!? When Molly was here I was like, "what!?" But, okay! Well, Patty seems cool. She's funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, she has to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. The fat chick seems great. You never know, bro, that fat chick could wind up being the love of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk returns a look of annoyance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty, I'm saying. Patty could be the love of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game has started. Kirk, Stainer, Molly and Patty are cheering. The puck smacks the glass before them and anoth player skates up for it. As he mucks it from the edge, he looks up and sees Molly. He's distracted just long enough get brutally checked face first into the glass. A penalty called on the player who hit him. That player skates into the penalty box near Molly. The name on his jersey reads, "REESE." He speaks with a thick Canadian accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Molly!     Yer lookin' good, eh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a bogus call, Bobby.    Your skates barely left the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   What's that aboot, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously to Reese) Yeah, that ref is like a total blindo, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blindo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, Molly's sister is blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not offended) Oh, I know. It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio announcers are calling the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty Five seconds left on the Power Play and the Sharks are knocking at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, after the game, you wanna party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know my policy on players, Bobby. And you might have noticed we've already got dates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The penalty ends and the ref opens the box but Reese is n paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Molly. Just give me a chance, eh.   I'm a great guy - ask any of these assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is booing Reese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reese, you'd better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't seriously be blowing me off for these two hosers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Fuck you Reese!    You suck this year anyway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reese raises his squirt bottle over the glass and squirts Stainer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer is immediately on his feet, climbing the glass an trying to pummel the huge player. Security is on him in a flash and dragging him, kicking & swearing, out of th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reese wakes up and skates out of the box but it's too lat The Sharks score and the crowd revolts. A red-haired redn woman, sitting two rows back, calls out to Molly and comp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You idiots just cost us a goal!    I hope you're happy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better check that tone, Reba! You do NOT want me comin' up there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty! Stop it! I'll go see what I can do about Stainer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is my fault, I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay. I know the head of security. I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly exits and Patty sits back down next to Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I'm really embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, if Reese did that to me I'd have gone over the glass too. But I would have landed a few before they got me. Reese has been all over Molly ever since she dumped her boyfriend. I tell you, that girl has nothing but trouble when it comes to men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? How is that even possible? She's so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. I'm no lezbo but sometimes she makes me want to strap on - if know what I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   I think I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a curse, looking like that. Who has the balls to hit on her? Just the most arrogant A-holes like Reese out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Molly brought me along tonight because, you know, she thought I might be 'interested.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, just for honesty's sake, I'm not interested. No offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Hey! None taken. I don't blame you. I know I'm no Brad Pitt. That's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You? No, I'm talking about your pal, Stainer. I know he's your friend but he seems like kind of a dumbshit. (THEN) Wait. Why would you think I was talking about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     I didn't mean to assume anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. You don't have a clue do you? Molly's really into you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk laughs hard until he realizes that Patty isn't laugh Patty's nod says, "I'm serious."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... why would...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knockout like Molly be interested in a spud like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got me. Again, no offense. But listen, Kirk, your dream girl just showed up. Try not to blow it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Kirk's terrified expression.   The SOUND of a bo ball demolishing ten pins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is crowded and classic rock is cranking. It's a old alley with overhead-projection score sheets. Kirk, Stainer and Devon sit and talk while Jack throws a strike

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atta boy Jackers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't add up, Kirk. If Molly's so into you, why bring her friend and give you two tickets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was hoping to set Patty up with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, she wasn't interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're saying the hottest babe in the world wants you and the fat chick isn't into me. Will you listen to yourself? Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Molly have to say about all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Stainer, somebody got thrown out of the game and I had to drive him home, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty impressive catch, Kirky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way. Don't get him all worked up. Her friend was fuckin' with him. Molly said herself that Patty loves to mess with people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, you deserve a gal like her. And Stainer, why don't you try to be a little more supportive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you try a little shut the fuck up, Devon. This week, we're not taking dating tips from the guy who met his wife in eighth grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we still bowling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer picks up a crappy, beat up ball from the ball ret

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is - she's just too hot. No judgement on Kirky, the guy's just outgunned here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't argue with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer goes to the line. The BOWLER (a pro-type with a custom ball and glove) on the next lane is already standi about to roll. Stainer starts to step up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, house ball! I was up first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh for fucks... What is it with you people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wait your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this noise and bullshit in this place and I'm such a distraction over here in your god damned peripheral vision!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Stains, take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bowler stands glaring back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well!?   Fuckin' roll then!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bowler takes another minute to set. Stainer lets out long sigh. The bowler steps to the line and Stainer rushe into his own delivery. Both men throw gutters. The bowler comes at Stainer but their friends separate them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah!?    Bring it, Brunswick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer!    Cool your jets, buster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bowler's friends drag him away. Stainer takes a deep breath before he shifts right back into conversation mode

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Anyway... I love Kirky but let's face it, the guy's a three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer, that's just dirty pool. He's at least a four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're outta your fuckin' mind - four! You go ahead and pump rainbows up his ass. I'm just being honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer moves the score sheet and then writes a three on glass. It projects onto the overhead scoreboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can live with three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a nice guy and he's funny. Those are a half a point each.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer continues the equation on the projector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he drives a shit box so we gotta deduct a point for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk said she likes his Taurus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so fucked, I won't even dignify it with a response. So we're back to three. Meanwhile, this Molly is a hard ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hard ten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Generally, if a broad is that hot you can deduct a few points for dumb or shallow but she went to law school and her sister's blind. That's a hard ten, friends, and that is rare. A seven point disparity - that's a chasm. The most you can jump is two points. I can't even get a ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, not even you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a five, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.    Then what am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a seven and a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, you're a five then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so I get a two point bump for being in a band. That puts me at seven. On a good day, most I can bag is a niner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your shitty car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artist exemption. I'm expected to have a shitty car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there an artist exemption for being a jag-off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A there is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer's right. Patty was probably just messing around. It's not a big deal. Let's just bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Rick Ocasek?   Billy Joel, Donald Trump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, dumbass. Those are the wild- cards. Money and fame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, if he were a millionaire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mil ain't what it once was, Jackie. Devon's practically a millionaire for Christ sake. A mil might get you an eight but to bring down a ten now days - two million minimum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer finishes the equation by writing, "Kirk = Fucked. Kirk's phone rings. He checks the ID and his eyes go wide

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Hey, Molly... Um, yeah, sure... No, that sounds good. Yeah, I know where that is. Um, okay, yeah... see you then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk hangs up and gapes at his friends, who wait in suspe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy crap. (dazed pause) She just asked me out for tomorrow night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk exchanges fives, fists, tips and hugs with Devon and Jack. Stainer shakes his head, still not buying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk runs into the otherwise empty restroom. He stares in the mirror and his smile fades into panic. He splashes wa on his face. He reaches for a paper towel but the dispens is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) It's okay. Get it together. Guys do this all the time. You can do this. You can make it happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from inside a stall) You better not be jerking off in the sink, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's Taurus pulls into a space. He climbs out and slams the door. As it closes, he reaches but too late. He looks through the window. The keys are hanging in the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLY, the Russian driver, is chipper and bubbly as he si along with "I'm Like a Bird" on the radio. Kirk is knocke around by Willy's crazy driving. In the mirror, Willy notices Kirk's dazed expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thick accent) Kirk! You look like someone made a second number in your breakfast cereal. You are doing okay, yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what Willy. I honestly don't know how I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does not know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be doing awesome but I don't know. Know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect! Willy is having another kick ass of a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy takes a hard left and some suitcases fall on Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk is picking up a coffee. As he walks on, he takes a s The lid comes off and hot coffee spills on his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, Big Slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer is now next to Kirk, who glares back at him as th walk across the food court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short, plain girl behind the Orange Julius counter give them an apprehensive wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.    Let's go this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer returns an uncomfortable smile but then redirects their path away from her. Kirk waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody. Just some chick I boned once when I was drunk. You look like shit, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I had trouble sleeping last night. This Molly thing... I don't want to want this, you know? It just seems too good to be true. I just don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you mean.   There has to be some explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't think of one.   Not one that makes any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's spitball it a little. You've got dick for money so she's no gold digger. Oohh! Did you ever see Double Indemnity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't say she wants me to kill someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then... maybe she's on a scavenger hunt. You know, like find a wagon wheel, a wiffle ball bat and a fat, bald TSA agent - that kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk is no longer responding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit, dude. Al Qaeda. Think about it. You're a TSA agent, she's a terrorist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, still in his TSA uniform, walks past a large laundr to a small storefront next door. The chipped and faded lettering on the glass reads, "Maury Hammerstein, Attorne Law - Aggressive, Dynamic Representation Since 1942!" As Kirk reaches for the door, he notices a small hand-writte sign, "I don't make change!" He goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wood paneling, buzzing fluorescent lights and furniture t Salvation Army would sell only as firewood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Debbie sit with Kirk's parents. There are two elderly women and another middle aged man in the room as well. Maury, who's about a hundred years old - cute and meek, fusses with an ancient VCR while smoking a cigarett

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk sits down next to Eric. Kirk notices a free bank calender on Maury's desk - dated 1991.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about time, numbnuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came right from work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Maury - we're all here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! You bet! You betcha! Okay, hi there Kirk. Firstly, let me just say how awful sorry I am. Stella was one heck of a gal and a real dish. Anyhow, let me just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maury gets the VCR going.   "Wheel of Fortune" comes up o screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh mercy. I didn't tape over her with The Wheel did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The picture goes to snow and then stutters into a shot of Grammy sitting in her kitchen. She has just clicked the video camera on with a remote control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good.    There she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testing. One, two, three, four. Oh, this God damned thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and fusses with the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jap piece of shit! Is it on!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutaway to Kirk tearing up.   Grammy sits back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, my name is Stella Edith Dakin and if you're watching this, I'm dead as a doorknob and I ain't spent all my money yet. I got shit to do today so I'm going to get right to it. This is my last will and testament and if you miss anything the old Jew's got the paperwork. Okay, here's the deal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone besides Kirk leans in, excited to hear what they might get. A phone rings. Maury looks around but the ringing is coming from the TV. Grammy answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? I'm kind of busy right now Eric... Oh, for God's sake, boy! How can you be sure it's even yours? It could be practically anybody's!... No, I'm not paying for that!... Well, then I guess you're going to be a daddy. Congratulations, now I gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up, puts on her glasses and lights up a smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway! I love all of you, despite some of the shit you pulled, but I spent my life a gambler and I always put my money on the best bet. The odds of any of you fish doing anything worthwhile with my stack are slim to none. So old Grammy's going all in on Big Slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks at Kirk who is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you, Kirk. Don't let your old Grammy down. Do something good with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blows a kiss, lifts the remote and aims it at the cam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for Christ sakes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws the remote at the lens.    The picture goes to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Kirk gets it all!?   That is bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, it can't be much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maury digs into his desk and pulls out a mess of papers. dons a pair of glasses that make his eyes look gigantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see here... Looks like she had herself six G's in savings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, another three grand in bonds, give or take. Her life insurance will pay pert-near seventy grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He adds this up on an old adding machine (the kind with t hand crank) and writes $77,800 on a chalk board, which is mounted on the wall behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She left him eighty grand!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of Stella's retirement home expenses were covered by her reverse mortgage. But, figure in thirty thousand still due to Arborwood Village. She racked up forty-seven thousand in medical bills. And my fee, of course, which now stands at two thousand and change - which is real reasonable, folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He writes "Liabilities = $79,000    Total -$1,200."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Kirk owes money!? HA! Shit, man! That is God damn hilarious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The upscale restaurant is crowded. Kirk and Molly are eat at a small table. Kirk is not relaxed like he had been th last time they ate together. He is sweating and trying to remain cool. The Maitre d is eyeing them suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, you can't legally be held responsible for her debt. What kind of hack is this attorney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.     I had it in savings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter brings a drink to Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French accent) Madame. From ze gentleman in ze grey suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From his table, a good looking man smiles and raises a dr to Molly. She nods back - polite but annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway... Grammy hated owing anyone money. I'm afraid she couldn't rest if she wasn't square with the house. It's the least I can do. She practically raised me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good man, Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly smiles and takes his hands. The maitre d is watchin and getting angry. The waiter returns with another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From ze gentleman in ze purple tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another guy raises his glass to her from the bar. Molly i getting irritated. Kirk is feeling smaller every minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, no more drinks.    Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.     No more drinks, madame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     This happens sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I get that a lot too. I'm sure the next one will be for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly laughs. The best looking man Kirk has ever seen wal up to the table. He and Molly hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my gosh! Talon! I didn't realize you were in town already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just flew in this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, this is Talon.    This is my good friend, Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great to meet you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talon gives Kirk a winning handshake, complete with wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, do we have you for our Disabled Angels Program again this year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't miss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fantastic. (to Kirk) Mol is always a big hit with the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. You're the one the kids go crazy for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you two work together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only once a year. Talon is our charity liaison at the air show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my ex-boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk starts to choke. He grabs his water glass and takes swig but the ice collapses and the water pours all over h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, boy.   I guess I better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk heads off to the bathroom, muttering to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid.    Stupid. Stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk is drying his shirt. A man is still zipping up as he takes the next sink. Before washing, he offers a handshak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. My name is Max Fleming. I'm a financial planner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk takes the handshake reluctantly and then gets a busi card. Max then starts to wash up - so does Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please forgive me but I'm curious. Who manages your portfolio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My portfolio? I don't really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max takes the last paper towel - forcing Kirk to drip dry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay if you'd rather not say. I admit that selling my services in a men's room is a tad aggressive but isn't that what a man of your means requires in his financial planner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judging by the company you're keeping, I'd say that you're making a handsome living. I can help you do even better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk exits reading Max's card - somewhat bewildered. The Maitre d stops Kirk and speaks in a French accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excusez-moi Monsieur.   Might I have a word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure.    Is everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maitre d looks around and then leans in and speaks quietly - now without the French accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kids eat here. My mother's here right now you son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Did I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I can appreciate that this is not some common street-walker. You're obviously willing to pay for the best but we can't have this kind of thing at my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I'm not paying anyone. We're just on a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are on a date with her? What am I an idiot? Now, I don't wish to embarrass you, sir, or make a scene. So, enjoy your dinner but, be warned, do not ever bring another professional into my place. (louder and back into the French accent) Tres bien Monsieur!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Kirk rounds the corner, he sees that Molly and Talon still talking. Kirk hides behind a plant. Molly is beamin She stands to hug Talon and kiss his cheek before he exit the restaurant. Kirk returns to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.   Did I miss Talon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had to go but he asked me tell you how much he enjoyed meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Super. He, uh, seems like a great guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is. He's wonderful. I know, I know - the blue eyes and the rock hard abs, right? But he's really so much more than that. A gallery in New York just opened an exhibit of his photography. He's a genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the waiter) Can we get the check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame, your bill has been covered by ze woman in ze Raiders Jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A butch woman in the bar raises a glass in Molly's direct

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Kirk pull into a parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh! This is your apartment? I used to live in this neighborhood back in college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm gonna move to a better place pretty soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We used to come to parties over here sometimes. Oooohh. Can I come up and see your place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Friday night and several college parties are raging the complex. Kirk leads Molly up the stairs and down the balcony hall toward his door. They pass a few college students on the way; a couple making out, a guy vomiting bush. Two apartment windows are covered with tapestries o Bob Marley and a giant pot leaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Molly enter.   The apartment is neat, clean and fairly sparse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not much, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I like it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly walks around and examines certain items. Kirk quiet hides a framed picture of Marnie. Molly passes his comput desk where she coos at a screensaver of baby polar bears. Just as she passes it, she bumps the mouse and the comput comes to life, revealing a "Hot Back-Door Asians" website Molly didn't see it and Kirk scrambles to turn off the monitor. She turns to see what he's doing. He smiles. She moves on to a rack of DVDs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, we have a lot of the same DVDs. Life of Brian, Cool Hand Luke, Family Guy... Beaches, Kirk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   It's a good movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love that movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots a crate full of vinyl records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, records. No Way! Look at all this Cheap Trick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like Cheap Trick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? Heaven Tonight is the first album I ever owned! A hand-me-down from my big sister. She was the coolest person in the whole world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices an upright piano in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You play the piano?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little. My grandma taught me. It was kind of our thing. She was a great player. Ragtime, show tunes, that kind of thing. I'm really not very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She plops down on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'll bet you're great.   Play something for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't really play in front of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, the stage fright thing?    Come on it's just me. Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I really can't. Trust me, you're not missing anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk decides to join her on the couch but then he balks i a little dance of almost sitting. He finally commits to s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've never played in front of anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Almost did once. A talent show in high school. I just sat up there drenched in sweat. I really thought I could do it but then I made my big mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess. You looked at the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. All these eyes on me. I'm shaking, my head is spinning, I'm trying to remember if I even play the piano... and then, I puked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there on the stage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTO the piano actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! You're lying!      Why would you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a reflex. I was trying not to barf on the floor. Turns out it's a lot easier to clean puke off a stage than out of a baby grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that has to be a real bitch. Oh, I shouldn't be laughing. You poor thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly brushes his hair back with her hand. Kirk is frozen with fear. Molly leans in. Kirk also leans in but not too far. Molly smiles, realizing that it's up to her to make this official. She takes him by the collar, reels him in kisses him. They make out for a moment. Kirk is near pani but he does his best to keep it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'm a little cotton-mouthed. I'm going to get a glass of water. How 'bout for you? Water? A nice glass of, you know...water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   That sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk steps away from her and disappears into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours a glass of water. He's about to return when he s his reflection in the window. The boner under his khakis not subtle. He looks down and starts to panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... You want anything to eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk opens the fridge and thrusts his pelvis in. He takes few deep, calming breaths.   He closes the fridge - still full alert. Kirk searches the kitchen, his panic building He grabs a Time Magazine. He flips through frantically. H turns to a bikini model in an ad, then a naked aboriginal women, then bare breasts in a breast cancer article.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is sweating like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I give you a hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk finally flips to a picture of Barbara Bush.   He sta at it hard. His boner begins to retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Kirk, I want you to know that I would really like to, you know, to be with you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boner pops back up. Kirk silently mouths, "MOTHERFUCK at his mischievous little man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sure. But... I just don't think I'm ready yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's reply is rushed with enthusiastic relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure! Sure! Yeah! No problem! Great! That's...that's great! Ice!? You want some ice!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk opens the freezer. He puts a few cubes in her water then grabs a fistful and shoves his hand in his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly gets cozy on the couch and looks even sexier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, don't get me wrong. I want to! Believe me - getting naked and crazy sounds fantastic right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
