dialogues.text: Kirk runs the water while he digs under the sink. He find duct tape. He pulls some tape off the roll. It makes a lo noise that causes Molly to pause and Kirk to tense up. Ki opens his pants and begins taping down the trouble-spot. coughs hard to cover each subsequent tug of the tape roll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think we should get to know each other first.   I'm no prude. I mean, I'm pretty generous in bed. Once I trust a person, I like to experiment and get pretty wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I just need to feel safe first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk finishes taping up, zips his pants and checks his profile in the reflection from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk returns with two glasses of water and no visible bon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.   I'm totally fine with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk gives an "aw-shucks" head tilt.    Molly stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well, I'd better go then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk to the door. Molly leans in and they kiss a few moments more. Kirk winces as the tape is getting a little snug. She drops her keys and then goes down on one knee t retrieve them. Suddenly she starts coughing. She puts her fist over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's POV:   As her head and fist bob in front of his cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk winces again. She hears the tape start to give way. She looks up, slightly confused. Kirk looks around as tho he's looking for the source of the sound. Molly stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a really nice time.    I'll call you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk opens the door for Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Molly exits, she gives him one last kiss. Two studly m college students are playing foosball on their patio. The stop when one points out the hottie who's kissing Kirk. Molly trots off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, man!     That chick is fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk returns a cool "whassup" nod to the guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right Mr. Kettner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna play some foos!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk beams from the attention as he goes back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drifts over to his piano and sits down. The joy of wha has just happened is plastered on his face. He launches i a furiously happy Jerry Lee Lewis style romp. Soon a neighbor is pounding on the wall. Kirk stops playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mrs. Neusbaum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk continues his celebration, dancing around the apartm He picks up the picture of Marnie and speaks to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron seems like a swell guy. I love Pizza Hut. What? Who's this? Why, this is my girlfriend, Molly. Oh, don't be that way. Oh, there, there, now. Here's a tissue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the picture and continues the dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk lies in bed staring at the ceiling fan. The smile continues as he drifts off to sleep. Time lapses as Kirk sleeps and the sun comes up. Still smiling, his eyes open like a shot and he reaches for his phone - "No Missed Cal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1) Kirk gets up and goes into the bathroom.   He checks h gut and hairline in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2) From under his bed, he pulls out a Total Gym still in box. It is dusty, unopened and has a ribbon still attache along with a card that reads, "Happy Graduation - Love Mo and Dad." He sits in the living room bewildered as he rea the directions. The parts are spread out all over the flo He works out on the machine but it soon violently collaps underneath him. He checks his phone. "No Missed Calls."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3) He throws away unhealthy snacks and treats from the cupboards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens an untouched box of Healthy Bran and fills a bow He watches cartoons as he heaps sugar on the healthy cere and then checks his phone. "No Missed Calls."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3) He surfs the web. He reads info on the Hair Club For M site. He moves to Hot_or_Not.com. The first woman is very pretty. He rates her a seven, the next is also pretty and gets another seven, the next girl is very unattractive. H score is three. Kirk feels bad for her and rates her a te He checks his phone. He moves on to "BackDoorAsians.com."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4) Kirk watches a Connery James Bond movie on TV. The low third reads, "AMC's 24 Hours of Bond." No Missed Calls. T sun is setting and Bond is now Roger Moore - No Missed Ca Kirk digs a box of Ding Dongs out of the trash and eats t as he watches. It's dark outside and Kirk is in bed watch Timothy Dalton - No Missed Calls. The morning light is creeping in as Pierce Brosnan does the driving and Kirk i still awake looking devastated - No Missed Calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5) Kirk is at a convenience store buying milk. He is a me tired, unshaven, wearing a frumpy sweatsuit. He passes th magazine rack and something catches his eye. It's a gorge picture of Molly on the cover of Phoenix Entrepreneur Magazine. Kirk holds up the magazine and then catches his own reflection in a mirror on a sunglasses rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6) Kirk is walking home. Every street sign, billboard and shirt he sees reads, "NO MISSED CALLS."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands in the shower sulking. He hears the phone ring the next room. He jumps out, grabs a small towel and star to dry off as he runs into the bedroom. He reaches the charger base but the phone is not there. He stands and listens hard to the ringing. He runs into the living room Angle on the phone. It's hiding under a pillow on the cou In the background, Kirk rushes around the room flipping u papers and magazines. The phone keeps ringing and Kirk's panic increases until he finally spots the phone. Kirk di for it, losing his towel in the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!?   Hello!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took you long enough. What were you doing, taking a growler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk notices a woman on the landing outside behind him. can see his ass through the window. He covers up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mrs. Nuesbaum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Stainer come out of a record store and walk past shops and restaurants. Kirk holds a stack of flyers for Stainer's band. As they walk, Kirk hands flyers to Staine who posts them on walls and kiosks with a staple hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, it's a simple rule of life. Look around. People are pretty evenly matched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Stainer look at the couples that stand at the bu stop, sit in the outdoor cafes and walk down the sidewalk Each couple is fairly closely matched - pretty with prett ugly with ugly, heavy with heavy, fit with fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but Stainer, she was the one who asked me out. So, why...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That first night, were you intimidated by her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I didn't think I had a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. So you were relaxed and funny. You were on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer posts several "Wheel in the Sky" flyers on a kios

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I gotta get back to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just it, Kirky. Now that she's opened the door, you can't get back to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'll have to fake it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. You can't fake that far. A broad like her - she'll smell that horseshit a mile away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Stainer enter a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and take a table on the crowded patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get a couple of menus? (then to Kirk) You eating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe just a salad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, one salad ain't going make up for thirty years of chili dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But I got dinner with my folks later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fun. Be sure and stab your brother in the eye with a fork for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Eric's not coming tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk motions toward a mismatched couple (nerdy guy with knockout girl) who pass Kirk and Stainer's table on their to the valet stand. Stainer rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what - this is ridiculous. I'm just going to call her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you are! Put that thing away. You do not call her. Don't you get it? Talon is back in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she broke up with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're telling me you were sitting there, a sweating, quivering stutter-bucket and when you came back from the can, Molly's hugging a guy who's so good looking you'd probably fuck him. What do you think she's doing this weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what am I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can you do? She hasn't called - she's not going to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're probably right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just count yourself lucky. You got to kiss a goddess and you got out before she recalibrated your hardware. A chick like that can raise the bar too high and then once she dumps you, nobody else measures up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're right. You know what - it's good. It's better. I'm actually relieved. You should have seen this Talon guy. Man! All I've been thinking about is having to be naked in front of her. I don't need that kind of pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The valet pulls a red Ferrari up to the mismatched couple the nerdy guy opens the door for her. Stainer shakes his head as if to say, "Was there even a doubt?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's phone is sitting on the table - it rings.   Kirk a Stainer can see Molly's name on the caller ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings again. Kirk glances down at the phone. Stainer keeps a stern eye on Kirk. RING! Close on Kirk's eyes turning weak. RING! Close on Stainer's threatening eyes. RING! Kirk gives up and looks away. Stainer's eyes calm. Kirk snatches the phone but Stainer grabs Kirk's wrist, pinning it to the table. RING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RING! Kirk reaches for the phone with his other hand but Stainer's free hand intercepts it and these arms flail ar like battling snakes. Kirk presses the button to answer t call and, instead, moves his head down to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!?... Oh, no problem! Yeah I was super busy yesterday anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you look at yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer lets go and Kirk sits up and backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I have dinner with my folks tonight... Oh, I wouldn't want to subject you to them... Okay. If you want to. I can pick you up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk gives a confident smile and an "I told you she'd cal nod. Stainer crosses his arms and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure. Well then let me call you back in a few minutes and I'll give you directions. Alrighty. Yeah. Buh-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess you just solved that. An hour with your family and she'll file for a restraining order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Eric's not going to be there. It's going to be good. You might be wrong about Molly. She might...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer spots a round little boy posting a "Lost Puppy" f over one of the ten he just posted on the kiosk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the boy) Whoa! I don't think so Spanky!   A little lower!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy instead posts it over a "Walk For a Cure" poster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly drives up and stops in front of a small home on a quaint residential street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs out of her car, checking the address on a smal sheet of paper. She sees Kirk sitting on the front porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had good directions!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps up the front walk toward Kirk, who points to a little yellow note taped to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. My folks aren't back yet. We're locked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a key?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. My dad's kind of obsessed with home-security. Like someone's going to break in and steal his Reader's Digest collection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very old man wobbles out of the house next door with a beagle on a leash. The man struggles a bit with the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Riley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, howdy Kirk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what do say you take the night off and I'll take Noodle around the block for you? (to Molly) Are you up for a walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geeze Kirk, that's mighty nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk jogs over to take the leash.   Noodle jumps up on Ki He and Molly pet the excited dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (baby talk) Yes! Always happy to see you, pretty girl! Yes you are a pretty girl! Yes you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly takes note - animal lover - big points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good boy, Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no trouble at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Kirk start down the sidewalk with Noodle. An ol woman comes out of the next house with her dog on a leash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey!?   Are you back in business!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Molly) I had a little neighborhood dog- walking service when I was a kid . (to the woman) No problem, Mrs. D, we can take Norton along too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several soft-faded cuts as Kirk and Molly move through th neighborhood. Soon they have a third dog. Kirk points out landmarks as they talk and laugh. Now they have a fourth dog. Molly takes his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The evening light is a bit dimmer as they give Noodle bac Mr. Riley. Kirk turns toward his parents' house. Now there's a car parked in the driveway and a jacked-up, kno tired pick-up parked out front. The truck has two bumper stickers ("One Nation Under GOD!" and "No Fat Chicks!") flanking a vanity license plate that reads, "ERIX-TOY." Kirk's shoulders slump at the sight of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you know what I'm thinking, let's go get Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?   I want to meet your family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start toward the door.   Molly's cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. It's Patty. I've got to take this. Go ahead. I'll be right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk comes through the front door to find his father in t living room watching a hockey game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking up) Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi sweetie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric steps out of the kitchen with three beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close the door, fucknut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Eric. I thought you were hanging drywall tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. Fuckin' Leroy fired me again. Like that dick never came to work with a little buzz on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, listen, I brought a date tonight. I really like her. Please don't embarrass me in front of her. I'll do anything you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise I won't mention her goiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Dad crack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flushing sound and then Ron comes out of the bathroom. He's buckling up. Kirk's shoulders drop again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did like you said Mr. K.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric tosses Ron and Mr. Kettner each a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey Ron. So Marnie's here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie appears in the door of the kitchen. She's holding corningware pot filled with mashed potatoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly finishes her call. She's up the front steps and Kir lets her in. Eric, Ron and Mr. Kettner are stunned. Marni drops the pot and it smashes on the floor in front of her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Kettner and Debbie rush out to see what Marnie is ga at. Debbie (still pregnant) is immediately threatened by way Eric is looking at Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone, this is Molly McCall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's never seen his family so impressed. He can't hide grin. Ron pops the cap off his beer and it overflows a bi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, Molly, Mr. & Mrs. Kettner, Marnie, Ron and Debb around the kitchen table and feast on a meatloaf dinner. Eric is at the fridge grabbing a beer. Marnie is angrily watching Ron whose eyes are all over Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want another one Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two take it easy now. We have guests. (THEN) Eric honey, I'm sure if you apologize to Leroy, he'll take you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric returns to the table with the beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, fuck him. Anyways, Leroy ain't payin' shit ever since he trucked in all those spics from Fresno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geeze Eric!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron looks offended and raises a palm to indicate that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got this, Kirk. Eric, before you go bad-mouthin' a whole group of people, you should know that my grandmother on my father's side is from Fresno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm sorry. I didn't know. (THEN) So, Molly. What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an event planner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see? That's using your head. That's a business to get into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Book a band, blow up a few balloons and people pay out the ass for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a little more to it than that, Eric. Molly handles some big events. She's even doing a benefit with Billy Joel next month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PLAYFULLY) Actually, Eric's right.   Just a few balloons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly smiles to reassure Kirk that she can handle herself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Molly, I'm a business owner myself. A little restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't really call it a restaurant, Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We serve food that people eat.   So - restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Pizza Hut with no tables. It's a take out place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Molly, me and Debbie here are getting hitched. What do you get for a wedding job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk raises his eyebrows into "please-behave-yourself" pu dog eyes. Eric shoots back an "oh whatever" sneer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. Honestly, I don't really do a lot of weddings. I specialize more in fund-raisers, corporate events, that kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOLLY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now I'm working on the annual benefit for the Children's Cancer Center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you've done weddings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOLLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done a few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you get for one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, could you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get your panties in a wad, Kirk. He's just making conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOLLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geeze, there are so many factors that affect the cost of a wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking at about two hundred people and we're gonna do this whole Nascar theme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting a kick-ass dress made out of actual checkered flags and Eric is going to be in an orange tux with a big Home Depot logo on the back and Tony Stewart's number 20 on the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOLLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, how fun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the damage for supervising something like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just talkin' ballpark. I'm ain't gonna try and Jew her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Before expenses, my base fee for a non-charity event is fifteen thousand. So, I'd ballpark that somewhere around twenty-five grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (STUNNED) Fuck a duck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment everyone is chewing and there is a break in conversation. Kirk is getting wound up tighter and tighte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're making a comfortable living, you seem like you got your head together more or less and Christ, look at ya. What the hell you doing with numbnuts here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Ma - we're all thinking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's fine. The truth is, Kirk and I are just getting to know one another but so far, I think he's decent, he's funny and... You know, when we first met, Kirk asked me in all sincerity if I knew how to do an oil change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, Ron and Mr. Kettner each let out a quick burst of " right" laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know! And, you're right, I don't but... I just love that he asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment passes as they all process this. The women at th table all know exactly what Molly means. The men are simp confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny? Kirk is funny?    Tell us a joke there Sinbad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kirk) Well I hope you can hold onto this one pumpkin. (to Molly) When Marnie broke up with him he was devastated for months, the poor little guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie looks up, surprised and touched by the comment. is mortified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit, when you dump him, he's liable to kill himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk rubs his own head to keep it from exploding. Molly c him with a hand on his back. This move isn't lost on Marn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk splashes water on his face and then looks for a towe but can't find one. He's forced to use his sleeve. He is wreck. He takes a deep breath and steps out into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to find Marnie at the front door putting her coat on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you heading home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to get home and let Peanut out. (she wipes some lint off of Kirk's shirt sleeve.) Kirk, you look really good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.   You do too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie smiles a sad smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron!   Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming! It was really fantastic to meet you Molly.   If you ever need a pizza...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron gives Molly a hug that makes Marnie as uncomfortable it does Molly. He then passes Kirk as he crosses to the front door, carrying a pile of foiled over paper plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cripes Kirk! Crack a window in there pirate! HAHAHA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron and Marnie exit.   Kirk walks back into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Kettner and Molly are cleaning up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, you don't have to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let us have some girl time. Take these downstairs to your dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands Kirk a bag of Fritos and shoes him through the basement door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's father has built a tacky little basement bar decor with neon beer signs and Eric's old trophies and ribbons. Mr. Kettner and Debbie sit at the bar and smoke as Eric stands behind the bar and serves them cocktails. Kirk com down the basement stairs and joins them. The hockey game wrap-up highlights are running on a TV mounted above the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what was the final score?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're hot shit now?    Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Eric, you've had a lot to drink tonight and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell him what to do. (to Eric) You're doing fine, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're better than me. Say it. Well take a look around, Big Slick. (re: trophies) Every one of these says Eric. First place! First Place! M.V.P.!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winner! Winner! You think you're the winner now? Well forget it, man! I don't buy this for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (STANDING) Well, it's been fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't be that way, boy. All your big brother is trying to say is that we're worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You show up here with that piece of ass!? Either you're fucking with us or she's fucking with you so which is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know she's a little out of my league but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little!? Are you shitting me? Alright, alright! I think we can all agree that Debbie here is one wicked hot box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie smiles and squeezes Eric's hand. Mr. Kettner nods raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's um... very attractive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and this Molly makes her look like a pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie lets go of Eric's hand and storms upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see? This girl of yours is already startin' shit. (Calling after Debbie) Come on baby! Kirk didn't mean nothing by that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know what's going on either but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm goin' upstairs and gettin' to the bottom of this.

dialogues.text: Good! Don't come back, Kettner! America is safer without you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer goes after Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk walks out the doors. Stainer catches up to him and t walk down the busy curb at a quick, angry pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirky! Hold up, man! What are you doing!? You can't let her screw up your life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me Stainer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Don't take it out on me! We both knew this Molly thing wasn't going to work out! It ain't my fault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. It's not your fault. It's my fault for listening to all your... pernicious advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you did was fill my head with all this crap about threes and tens and how I'm not worthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you worthy of a chick like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe! I don't know. But that's not the point! You're supposed to be my God damned best friend. You know what!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you were jealous and you set out to sabotage us from the start!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is total bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why weren't you there for me? What if she actually liked me!? Maybe with a little help, I could have pulled it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk steps onto an...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy (the Russian) is behind the wheel and as happy as e A few others are seated on the bus. Stainer follows Kirk board. They remain standing, holding onto poles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Kirk and his crazy friend Stinker and they are most upset!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy steps on it and drives like a maniac, knocking Kirk Stainer around as they argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, she was going to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me! I'm hurt now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy occasionally blurts out mindless echoes of their argument, which Kirk and Stainer mostly ignore, like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hurting now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The longer this went on the worse it would have been. I guarantee it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does not know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do, Kirk! I know exactly what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps he does know after all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember last year when you hardly saw me for about two months? I met my own perfect ten. Tina Jordan. Smart, cool and hot like you wouldn't believe. Hotter than Molly even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right. So how come I never heard a word about her until now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, how come no word of this Tina!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't tell anyone. I didn't want to jinx it. She was perfect. I was spilling over with...with fucking happy! You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking happy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two months into it, she dumps me. And I knew it was coming. A girl like that. Sooner or later she was bound to get a better offer. But it kicked my ass, man. I was depressed for months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what that was? You said you had that fatigue syndrome thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want everyone knowing what a pussy I was. Dude, it was a hurt I can't even put into words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a pussy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't watch you go through that 'cause I love you, man. You're the brother I never had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer leans over and hugs Kirk.   Kirk doesn't hug back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a brother, Stainer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but he's a cheese-dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's phone rings.    He answers, forcing Stainer to let

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maury sits at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk? Geeze, I'm glad I caught you. Listen son, I got something to tell you and don't get mad at me okay? 'Cause this thing ain't my fault. You might want to sit down for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk slumps into a seat and listens, looking upset and shocked. Stainer stares at Kirk, trying to get a sense of what Kirk is being told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty sits behind a reception desk in a small but stylish lobby. A sign above her desk reads, "McCall Events." Kirk walks in. Patty puts down her work and stares back at him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Molly in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got some big red apples showing your face around here again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm sorry.     I just...   Is she here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.     Get lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer bursts in sweating and panting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for Christ sake! This one too!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty comes out from behind her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm warning you both - Molly has been through enough. You go near her and I will fuck you all the way up! Understand!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer swaggers up into Patty's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK!!! Patty throws an elbow and Stainer's head jacks back. She is instantly on him, grabbing him in a headlock and punching him in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh!!   Jesus Christ!!! Kirk!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your Mommy!?   Come on!   Who's your Mommy!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right! Patty is, isn't she!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty! Cut it out! I just came to tell her that something happened! Something really major happened!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty stops punching and looks up curiously.      Stainer in the headlock - also curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty punches him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut your hole! (to Kirk) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First off, I'm sorry.   Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty rams Stainer's head into the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time you say you're sorry, dumbshit here gets his bell rung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay! Sorry!     I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty slams him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude!   Stop apologizing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! I know I was acting like an idiot. She's just so... Well, I was really having a hard time with everyone thinking I was Molly's brother or her co-worker or her gay friend or whatever. I mean, nobody believed that we were together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late for this shit, Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I've got it worked out now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty and Stainer wait for it. Kirk decides how to phrase

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Grandmother left me three million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty drops Stainer on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought she was a blackjack dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It turns out she bought stock in Caesars Palace back in the sixties. Nobody knew she still had it. I don't think she even knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. So, what does this have to do with Molly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?    Now it makes sense - me with her.    I'm a millionaire now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what, now you can afford her!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! I get it! It's not a whore thing! Now it works out in his own mind. Right!? He can relax and stop acting like a freak because now he's bringing something to the table! Right, Kirky!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Well, no. Now that you say it out loud... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, Kirk - I told Molly you were different but you're just as shallow and full of shit as the rest of them, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer is at his post watching the luggage on the x-ray monitor. Suddenly, he sees Kirk coming through followed b Marnie, Mr. & Mrs. Kettner, Eric and Debbie (still pr They are all wearing bright yellow sweatshirts. Stainer r around the machine to hug Kirk, who looks a little numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirky! How you been, brother!? What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and Marnie and the family are going to Branson. You know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're "Branson Bound."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer is referring to Kirk's shirt that reads, "BRANSON BOUND" in big letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EMBARRASSED) These were Marnie's idea. To make it easy for us to stick together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others come through. Their shirts are decorated likew

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer takes the boarding pass from Kirk's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, your flight doesn't leave for another forty five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Marnie) I'll meet you guys down at the gate, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie isn't pleased but she's going along with it.   Eri calls back as they all head to the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Stainer! Long time no see! Take care, bro!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he so nice all of a sudden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably because I'm getting three million dollars next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, that's right. (THEN) So you're back with Marnie then, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, but it's for the best. I'm more secure with her. I'm actually happy to be done with all that Molly craziness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron comes through security and over to Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Stainer. Hey Pirate, can you spot me a twenty. I want to get me one of them travel pillows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk gives Ron a twenty and Ron steps away.    Stainer is appalled. He calls after Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come I'm not a pirate!? (then to Kirk) Dude, do not tell me that he's going with you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He already bought his ticket and my dad likes him. It's no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me Big Slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk doesn't look into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me things are good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be such a drama queen. Things are fine. I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, man. It was good to see you, Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange an awkward handshake. Kirk walks away. Stainer stands alone, watching him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer tightens his jaw and runs his fingers through his hair. Finally he kicks his head back and, with great determination, he stomps off in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow Stainer past security, dodging passengers and cart He arrives at the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer marches up to the Orange Julius. A short, doughy, plain girl works the counter. (This is the same girl that Stainer had claimed to have "boned" earlier.) She's weari an orange visor and rubber gloves. Several customers are waiting but Stainer moves to stand in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up from her smoothie.    She has drink powder o face. She groans to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elmer, I've got customers here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina, I need to know right now why it didn't work out with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands a smoothie to a customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a large Julius.    Twelve fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is important. I was good to you. I was sensitive, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Desperado, you gonna order something or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer gets in the customer's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck you just call me!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for Christ's!     Tammy!   Can you cover me!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large crowd of passengers are waiting to board.   The g agent, makes an announcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay folks, we're going to start by boarding the A group. All A's are now welcome to board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie butts into the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SNOTTY) Look, I've got seven people in my party so we're going to need to board right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you folks in the A group?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What difference does that make!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, because you seem like a little bit of a B. May I see your boarding pass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. We're not in the A group but we're still getting on next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him the pass - marked "C."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it looks like you're a raging C. So, you're gonna want to take a seat until your group is called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stomps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer and Tina sit at a table. He sits with his head do like a sad little boy. She pities him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really liked you Elmer, but all that stuff about me being a ten and how lucky you were and always checking up to see if I was going to dump you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you did dump me, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could I do? You were all up in my business all the time. I couldn't breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my stupid job, wasn't it? You were embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work at Orange Julius, Elmer! If you would have just chilled out and been yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up her finger with an engagement ring on it. Stainer drops his head onto the table. Tina rubs his hair for a second and then walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk is somber as he finds his seat near the middle of th plane. From two rows back, Eric reaches over some other passengers to tap Kirk on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom fuckin' Wopat, bro!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric hangs up a high five and Kirk leaves it hanging. Kir takes a seat on the aisle next to Marnie. He gives Marnie forced smile. She puts her head on his shoulder. Pan over the window seat where Ron sits watching them, wearing his travel pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, there is a commotion at the front of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!? You don't have authority on board this aircraft!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer barges past the flight attendant, holding up his badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay folks! TSA! This guy's drunk as fuck and he shit himself. We gotta get him off the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer grabs Kirk by the shoulder, pulls him out of his and about two rows down the aisle before Kirk overpowers and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer!   What are you nuts!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right! I messed you up. We gotta fix this thing! Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer! No! Believe it or not, this isn't about you! In fact it's none of your business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirky! In junior high I peed my pants in class and Eric started calling me Stainer, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty soon everyone else started calling me Stainer because they knew it would make me cry. Then you told me to own that name, to call myself Stainer so nobody could hurt me with it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My point is... um... Oh, shit. I was just in the crapper and I had this thing all worked out. Damn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot is now behind Stainer and towering over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm going to have to ask you to exit the aircraft immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer turns into his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have to ask you to fuck off immediately before I feed you your own fuckin' teeth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot backs up and goes for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Stains! You're going to get arrested! And I won't be here to bail you out this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooohh! That was my point! You saved me! That time and a bunch of other times too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta let me save you this time. It's my turn! Your grandma didn't leave you three million bucks so you could take these a- holes to Branson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric gets up and steps into Stainer's face. In mid-senten and without pausing Stainer zaps Eric with a stun gun. Er sails back into his seat as Stainer continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people hardly know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer, I appreciate that you think you're helping me but I'm with Marnie now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, Marnie's a fuckin' bitch. (to Marnie) All due respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit him Kirk! Or else I will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuller and two other security people enter the plane.   T pilot briefs them on what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk! You said Marnie makes you feel secure but security is bullshit! Look at our jobs! It's all for show! For all we know, there's a bomb on this plane right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other passengers gasp and most of them look at Habib, sits a few seats behind Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuller grabs Stainer by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to see what I think of security!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer turns and punches Fuller in the face, knocking hi backwards onto the other agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Stainer, what did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk! When I added all this up for you I made one big mistake. You are a ten. YOU'RE A TEN, MAN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk just stares back. Fuller and the agents grab Stainer but he clutches a seat and stays put.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not buying any of this bullshit are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer loses his grip and the agents drag him off the pl Kirk sits down and Marnie comforts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over a bummed out song we see different areas of the airp People on moving sidewalks. People on escalators. Bags moving around on a carousel. People in line. Flight Arriv and Departure times. Food trays moving down a buffet. Bag moving by on the x-ray monitor. People walking like cattl to their gates. Through the crowd, we see a man running against the traffic. It's Kirk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly,   looking beautiful in a formal gown, moves throug sea of   tables. Hundreds of formally dressed people are seated   around the tables, eating dinner. Molly greets, kisses   and shakes hands with several people as she goes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk is huffing and puffing as he rounds the corner and arrives at the checkpoint. He looks around frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy!   Where's Stainer!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy points to a room marked, "Airport Security - Author Personnel Only."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk bursts in to find Stainer bent over a metal table. Fuller (with two black eyes) and another agent hold him d as a homeland security agent stands behind Stainer, givin him the full cavity search. Kirk doesn't miss a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stainer! I don't have a car here! I need your van!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on!    The keys are in my jacket!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jacket is hanging by the door. Kirk reaches in and grab the keys. He turns fast and exits. Fuller jacks Stainer's head onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirky wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens more slowly and Kirk regards his friend wi great reverence. Stainer strains to lift his head against Fuller's strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Kirk. (dramatic pause and music) It's three on the tree and the clutch sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM!   Stainer's head is jacked back onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks buddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This room is set up as a staging area for the cancer bene Patty and several others are buzzing around preparing for next phase of the evening. Molly enters, holding a walkie talkie up to her head and speaking into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I need the staff ready to help with bids when the auction begins. - over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we can spare anyone - over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty grabs the walkie talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie! We're not here to feed these people, we're here to cure fucking cancer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I want every one of those motherfuckers back there taking bids in fifteen - out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty tosses the walkie-talkie back and then crosses to h a group of young cancer patients, some in wheelchairs, to unpack their sculptures and label them for the auction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stressed-out woman in a BEEHIVE hairdo picks up a SMALL BOY's sculpture. She hails Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. McCall, we've got a big problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This young man has made an ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Well, what do you want from me? Kids make ashtrays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a cancer benefit. Don't you think this sends the wrong message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a really nice ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not bidding on the artwork; they're bidding on the kids. It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beehive sighs hard and hands the ashtray back to the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly turns around and a look of surprise comes over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverse to show Talon holding a ridiculously large flower arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to say I'm sorry and to put in a request for a second chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. McCall, the auction is underway - over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I have to get in there. Can we talk about this afterwards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking forward to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The emcee is taking bids on a little sculpture of an abst four-legged animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timothy Brigg's sculpture of a... fire truck? Sold to the woman in the green dress for four hundred fifty dollars. Congratulations ma'am and thanks so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly picks up the small boy's ashtray and joins the emce stage. She takes a deep breath before facing the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our next item... Well, here she is folks, the woman who donates her time to make this amazing event possible, our own Molly McCall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thanks, Bob. I'm so sorry for my tardiness. The next item up for bids is from nine-year- old Walter Benegan.
